中大高層為左整個音樂系係深圳唔顧全學系反對5月頭通過方案，之後6月3日先通知department head.


8 June 2020
Dear all,
I am writing to update you on the latest status of CUHK SZ’s proposal for a new School of Music.
As you recall, the department conducted a survey on Oct 26, 2019 seeking feedback from faculty, students and alumni about CUHK SZ’s proposal of a new School of Music there. The results of the survey came back on Nov 8 indicating that over 81% of the survey participants were opposed to such a proposal. I communicated the survey results to VC Tuan on Dec 5, 2019 and expressed to him that the department does not support the proposal and will not be involved.
On Wednesday June 3, I received the agenda for the June 10, 2020 senate meeting . To my surprise, the CUHK SZ's proposal for a B.A. degree program in Music Performance was included as an item for senate approval. Despite our efforts in voicing stakeholders' concerns and reservations, the proposal for B.A. degree program in Music Performance at CUHK SZ was endorsed by the senate APC (Academic Planning Committee) on May 13, 2020 without our knowledge.

At this point, I would like to thank you all for your patience and understanding on this matter, and I will continue to keep you apprised of the latest developments.
Best,
Frederick Lau
Chair, Department of Music
CUHK
